parts.text:
RNAseq

{
"description": "This script processes FASTQ files, aligns them to a reference genome using either STAR (recommended), HISAT2, or Tophat2, and performs secondary analyses such as differential expression, local splicing variation, and quality control.  It uses SLURM for job queuing and can be run as a single analysis or as a reanalysis using existing aligned and processed files. ",
"software_requirements": [
"STAR",
"HISAT2",
"Tophat2",
"RSEM",
"DESeq2",
"Cufflinks",
"MAJIQ",
"LeafCutter",
"fastqc",
"Trimmomatic",
"samtools"
],
"resource_requirements": [
{
"name": "threads",
"description": "Maximum number of threads or CPUs to be allocated to programs.",
"default": "Number of available processors on the system, excluding the first processor.",
"notes": "May be automatically adjusted to a lower value by the system."
},
{
"name": "mem",
"description": "Maximum amount of memory (in GB) to be allocated to programs.",
"default": "128 GB",
"notes": "May be automatically adjusted to a lower value by the system."
},
{
"name": "SLURMemail",
"description": "Email address to receive SLURM notifications.",
"default": "No email notifications",
"notes": "By default, only FAIL notifications are sent for all jobs, and FAIL, END notifications are sent for the last job."
},
{
"name": "SLURMaccount",
"description": "SLURM account.",
"default": "None",
"notes": "Required if your cluster system uses SLURM accounts."
},
{
"name": "SLURMpartition",
"description": "SLURM partition.",
"default": "None",
"notes": "Required if your cluster system uses SLURM partitions."
},
{
"name": "SLURMqos",
"description": "SLURM QoS (Quality of Service) settings.",
"default": "None",
"notes": "Required if your cluster system uses SLURM QoS settings."
},
{
"name": "customcmd",
"description": "Custom commands to execute before any other program.",
"default": "None",
"notes": "Useful for loading modules, setting environment variables, etc."
},
{
"name": "tmp",
"description": "Path to a temporary folder for intermediate files.",
"default": "A temporary folder within the destination folder",
"notes": "If your cluster system provides a fast local I/O disk, you can set this to a path on that disk for improved performance. Temporary files will be deleted at the end of the script."
}
],
"config_file": "The script can be customized using a separate configuration file named `file.ini`. The configuration file should be provided as the third argument when executing the script. If no configuration file is provided, the script will use default parameters.",
"output_format": "The script generates a variety of output files, including: \n - Alignment results (BAM files)\n - Differential expression results (CSV files)\n - Splicing variation results (CSV files)\n - Quality control reports (HTML, PDF files)\n - Archive of all results (TAR.GZ file)"
}
